intro: Pinus pseudostrobus subsp. nubicola, commonly known as the Mexican white pine, is a subspecies native to the highlands of Mexico. It is a coniferous evergreen tree characterized by its long, needle-like leaves and cones that mature to a reddish-brown color. The tree typically grows in well-drained soils and thrives in temperate climates with moderate rainfall. It plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing shelter and food for various wildlife species. Due to its ornamental value and timber potential, it is also cultivated in botanical gardens and horticultural settings.
